result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Batista was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence Credit for 157 days granted.
Court deems TIME SERVED.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 157 days granted if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 1

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol//drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Valid prescriptions to be taken only in the manner they were prescribed.  Comply with seeing psychiatrist/psychologist as recommended.

No violent contact with family or victims.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael M Batista

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael M Batista in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defense withdraws NGI plea.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- 90 Days jail CONCURRENT with Count 2.  Credit for 157 days.  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived

Count 2:
- 9 months Huber with standard release conditions CONCURRENT with Count 1. STAYED. Credit for 157 days if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Comply with seeing psychiatrist/psychologist as recommended.  No violent contact with family or victims.
Affidavit of Services for Court appointed examiner and billing statement, received and filed, by Dr. Engen.
filed by the Defendant regarding the case.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michael M Batista in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is not prepared to enter a change of plea at this time and requests an adjournment to work on a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michael M Batista in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties discuss how to proceed on a special plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on April 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michael M Batista in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense would like to proceed with the NGI plea.  Court will allow time for parties to decide how to proceed.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Filed by Behavioral Consultants in regards to the timeline for completing the ordered doctor's report.
Court grants extension of the report to be due to the Court by March 20, 2015.
Hearing on March 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by Behavioral Consultants requesting an extension of the Doctor's report due date until March 13, 2015. Reviewed and approved by the Court.
Order for Examination under 971.16
Hearing on March 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael M Batista in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense enters an amended plea of Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.  Court orders examination to be completed and report filed within 30 days.  Defense requests Dr. Collins do the examination.  Hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on February 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Michael M Batista in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defense presents bail arguments. State objects to any bail modification. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Atty. Mark Kershek appointed to represent the defendant.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint or the victims residence.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Michael M Batista in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
